jobTitle: Sr. Technical Program Manager, Infrastructure Global Initiatives
jobDescription: Job Summary DESCRIPTION We are a growing team of Technical Program Managers responsible for ensuring new mechanical and electrical products as well as generational designs are introduced into the global fleet of AWS data centers as production ready. In order to build on our existing New Product Introduction, and to ensure we continue to raise the bar on quality and benefit to our customers, we are seeking a candidate with strong product management, program management, and process engineering experience who will be responsible for setting the strategy and ensuring success for production readiness across a global portfolio. A successful candidate will rely on their experience to build the work flows, ownership models, templates, mechanisms, strategy, and obtain organizational buy-in. As important as creating new processes will be, a successful candidate will also identify inefficient processes and deprecate them or replace with more effective solutions. Each new product will follow this detailed but agile workflow from concept to release. We are a smart team of doers who work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in Data Center technology. As a TPM, you have an opportunity to develop the strategy to ensure the production readiness of every program raising the bar for the organization. You are the focal point around which we will build this strategy. We will rely on your ability to understand the organizational touch points, product readiness standards, and translate those into a repeatable and executable process. You will determine how to demonstrate progress against a critical portfolio of work. Your development work will be a force multiplier within the organization. You should be comfortable collaborating in a fast-paced and often uncertain environment, and contributing to innovative solutions, while demonstrating leadership, technical competence, and a bias for action. The impact of the changes are broad, so you will need to think big as you set the direction for your team. The Ideal Candidate If you are someone who has passion for product development, infrastructure design, and can focus on increased reliability, we would love to hear from you. The ideal candidate has the courage of conviction. They are quick on their feet, make solid decisions, and are flexible to see various sides of a situation. Your experience of building processes and tools will be extremely handy in this opportunity. You will have an opportunity to create and drive processes and automation that will influence multiple teams providing valuable visibility into the work that you will lead. It is important that you can earn trust of your peers, partners, and executives through your body of work and consistency. If you have exhibited these skills, you will enjoy this role. This role has high level visibility and it will test your skills of abstraction and attention to detail, at the same time. Key job responsibilities Responsibilities Be resourceful and remove ambiguity from creative solutions to complex technical and organizational challenges Develop the metrics for program success. Define, measure and report on these metrics. We make decisions based on data Create processes, mechanisms, and tools that shape the delivery of products and designs and at scale deployment in the AWS Data Center Fleet Energize and influence the business partner team to stay drive short term and long-term goals Earn trust through frequent and clear communication within teams and senior management regarding program progress Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree AND 7+ years of product development experience OR 10+ years of product development experience (experience can be substituted for degree) Experience in core project management disciplines including scope, schedule, budget, quality, along with risk and critical path management Preferred Qualifications The ideal candidate is a creative, leader with strong analytical skills. This opportunity requires excellent technical, problem-solving, and communication skills. Candidates should have experience defining projects, collecting requirements, writing detailed functional specifications, coordinating efforts to scope, schedule, and deploy new features sets; as well as analyzing cost/benefit of feature selection. An advanced degree is strongly preferred. The successful candidate will have a customer focus, a diverse work experience, and a business curiosity/strategic viewpoint. The candidate will have an attention to detail, good judgment, strong oral and written communication skills, and the ability to self-start and self motivate. and a business curiosity/strategic viewpoint with technical problem-solving and communication skills Solid analytical, quantitative, communication, and presentation skills Must be well organized and able to work effectively under time pressure Understanding of customer intelligence practices, profiling/segmentation and predictive modeling is a plus. Fluency in standard software, including: Excel, Word, and SQL Innovation development experience Why AWS? jobTitle: System Development Engineer II, Data Center Operations - Systems Automation Solutions (TNT) - Location Flexible
jobDescription: Description Amazon Web Services (AWS) provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. To meet the ever-growing demand for AWS Services around the globe, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. The Data Center Operations Systems Automation Solutions (TNT) organization within Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for talented engineers to join the team. Our team owns software and systems that automate critical Data Center Operations tasks and make it easier to deliver the highest availability and lowest cost for AWS customers. Our systems deliver the technology that allows thousands of technicians around the globe to smoothly and efficiently build out new capacity in the data center, or respond quickly and confidently to an issue with a server rack and rapidly get it back to a healthy state again. What we do makes a difference, and we’re just getting started! We are looking for developers who are passionate about making Data Center Operations run more smoothly and efficiently through automation. If you have what we’re looking for, come join a strong team in a highly-visible organization. You will have a significant impact on the day to day availability and efficiency of Amazon's Data Center Operations. A System Development Engineer On The TNT Team Will Develop infrastructure-as-code software to stand-up large distributed services Design data center infrastructure install, repair, and incident recovery solutions Identify and remove scaling bottlenecks in large-scale distributed systems Work with other engineers to build and manage massively scaled services Work with other engineers to diagnose and resolve customer issues Understand and implement security and operational best-practices Basic Qualifications A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field, or equivalent experience 3+ years of professional experience as a systems development engineer or in similar roles 3+ years experience and proficiency in one or more general-purpose programming languages, such as: Java, C/C++, C#, Objective C, Python, JavaScript, Ruby, or Go Preferred Qualifications A Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field 5+ years experience building and operating large-scale, highly available distributed systems or web services with a high degree of operational excellence 5+ years experience working with operating system internals, including network and storage subsystems 5+ years experience with core networking concepts (such as transport protocols, routing protocols, and load balancing) and technologies such as TCP/IP 5+ years experience with aspects of computer security, such as network security, application security, security protocols, and cryptography 5+ years experience setting up, maintaining, and automating the fleet management of production servers Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Description Do you love automating and streamlining manual processes? Do you have a passion for making things easier, better, faster and more efficient? Read on. We may have the right role for you. Systems Development Engineer interns work with technical leaders to refine technical direction, and then follow through with detailed review, designs, and truly innovative code. They are builders who are experienced in at least one scripting language, are familiar with networking concepts, and familiar with working in a Linux environment. They are the industry’s brightest engineers who innovate every day on behalf of our customers. If this sounds exciting to you - come build the future with us! AWS Systems Development Engineer internships are full-time (40 hours/week) for 12 consecutive weeks during summer 2023. By applying to this position, your application will be considered for all locations we hire for in the United States including but not limited to Seattle WA, Arlington VA, New York NY, Cupertino CA, East Palo Alto CA, Atlanta GA, Herndon VA. Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $47.65/[hr] in our lowest geographic market up to $60.85/[hr] in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site. Description Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking UPS Battery Maintenance Engineers to support our customers in multiple locations including: Phoenix, AZ; Herndon, VA; Las Vegas, NV; Columbus, OH; Boardman, OR; San Francisco, CA; Los Angeles, CA. At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth! Amazon is a place where builders can build. We hire the world's brightest minds and offer them an environment in which they can invent and innovate to improve the experience for our customers. We are looking to hire a highly motivated, best-in-class UPS Battery Testing Technician to join our growing Operations Services team. The team responsibilities include maintaining critical equipment in support of providing best in class availability for our data center customers. The UPS Battery Testing Technician will work closely with both internal customers, external vendors as well as coordinate regional resources to facilitate smooth work execution. This critical role is responsible for the preventative maintenance of UPS batteries in our data centers. Our ideal candidate is highly autonomous, very detail oriented, possesses strong written and verbal communication skills, and has significant experience in supporting critical infrastructure. They will possess the ability to design, develop, and deploy innovative solutions to address operational challenges. This role requires both independent contribution as well as the ability to work within multi-disciplinary teams. An expert level of understanding of battery systems is desirable, as the individual will be expected to identify areas for improvement as well as act on data provided from other teams and organizations. If you are passionate about the Customer Experience; you think and act globally; and you want to contribute to the operational excellence of Amazon.com data centers then this may be the challenge you’ve been looking for! Those with critical datacenter environment experience are strongly encouraged to apply. Key job responsibilities Apply preventative maintenance testing techniques in support of maintaining UPS batteries across our fleet of data centers Act as an ambassador for safety within the team and to promote safe working across the site Remain cognizant of and act in compliance with all security protocols Interact with engineers, technicians, project managers and management on a daily basis Work with engineers to develop detailed and creative solutions to complex problems, while keeping a watchful eye on timelines and costs Develop and maintain a good working relationship across all levels in the organization Ensure consistency in deployed configurations and track exceptions for follow up Execute predictive and preventive maintenance programs Provide support for LSE, weather events, planned, and unplanned outages Member of on-call rotation to support after hours event response Provide cross functional support for ATS and Non-destructive testing teams Candidate must meet and maintain all eligibility requirements to drive a company service vehicle, including but not limited to: must have a valid driver's license issued by the state in which they reside Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree or Technical (Military/ Trade School) Degree or an equivalent combination of education and relevant experience 1+ years of relevant work experience Preferred Qualifications Sound understanding of electrical and battery testing best practices, processes and tools Work experience in a critical environment Data center operations experience Team lead supporting data center operations environment with a history of assigning work to more junior technicians Ability to recognize safety concerns and maintain a safe work environment under NFPA 70e guidelines Organized self-starter with strong analytic abilities and proven problem solving skills Ability to maintain vendor relationships The pay range for this position in Colorado, New York and New Jersey is $39.38 - $41.56/HR; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. This information is provided per the Colorado, New York and New Jersey Equal Pay Acts. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via Amazon's internal or external careers site. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Company - Amazon Data Services, Inc. Job ID: A2226780

Job Summary DESCRIPTION Amazon Web Services (AWS) provides a highly reliable, scalable, and low-cost cloud platform that powers thousands of businesses in over 190 countries. AWS’ Infrastructure Supply Chain & Procurement (ISCaP) organization works to deliver cutting-edge solutions to source, build and maintain our socially responsible data center supply chains. We are a team of highly-motivated, engaged, and responsive professionals who enable the core sustainable infrastructure of AWS. Come join our team and be a part of history as we deliver results for the largest cloud services company on Earth! AWS Infrastructure is looking for a driven, and analytical, Waste Manager for its America's Reverse Logistics operation based in Greencastle, PA. The mission of AWS Reverse Logistics is to manage and scale Information Technology Asset Disposition (ITAD) services for Used Electronics and Electronic Equipment (UEEE) through secure and environmentally sustainable practices supporting asset recovery while safeguarding customer data and Amazon intellectual property. The Waste Manager will be responsible for overall waste operations of the facility, ensuring the facility is compliant with all environmental, health & safety laws and regulations. The Waste Manager will develop internal policies and procedures to manage a wide variety of used and waste electrical and electronic equipment. Additionally, the Waste Facility Manager will represent the facility during interactions with regulators pertaining to waste permit application, compliance and accompany the relevant person at public meetings as needed. The Waste Manager must have excellent communication skills (both oral and written), strong environmental regulatory knowledge particularly with respect to waste management regulations, and demonstrated success in program development and management. The optimal candidate is a high-judgment, solid waste/hazardous waste/e-waste subject matter expert, preferably with scrap-metal shredding experience. This individual will focus on operating and growing the business to support sustainability goals while maintaining strict compliance with regulatory operational requirements. This role will have a higher amount of travel expectations within the first 6 months of the role for pre-site launch activities and process training in current locations. Key job responsibilities Day to day management of the facility to ensure site compliance with all procedures. Identify and implement best practice to maximize production in the hours that the facility is permitted to operate. Ensure that product/waste materials handling, separation and delivery to appropriate outlets are conducted in the most environmentally and commercially responsible manner. Ensure that all licenses and permits necessary to conduct the waste business are complied with including EPA licenses. This should include downstream dispatch of products & waste. Ensure all personnel are fully trained for their role and that all work completed is in accordance with health and safety guidelines and best practices. Responsibility for ensuring a maintenance program is put in place and operated for all production and mobile operations. Produce weekly KPI reports detailing production, throughput and recovery figures from the facility. Ensure work performed by contractors, and employees is completed in accordance with AWS standards. Report and respond to facility emergencies including root cause analysis and corrective actions. Lead submittal of certain time-critical reports to various governmental agencies. Participate in regulatory audits and inspections. Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s or advanced degree in Electrical/Mechanical/Chemical/Environmental Engineering, or related technical or quantitative field, or additional 4+ years of related industry experience in lieu of a degree 6+ years of experience with waste and e-waste regulations, programs and standards, including sustainability and circular economy objectives 6+ years of experience in program, project or product management, or leading an implementation of a product Preferred Qualifications Experience and knowledge of state and federal environmental regulations in the United States Certified Waste Management Specialist or other similar certification Experience working with the tech/data center sector Experience working at a waste treatment, storage, and disposal facility E-waste and life cycle planning and management experience Experience in a fast paced, changing/growing organization Excellent organizational and project management skills Experience implementing lean principles and process improvement in an operational environment Excellent communication skills, strong relationship builder, solid influencing and negotiation skills, and the ability to coach at multiple levels Ability to distill complex and ambiguous subjects into clear action plans Strong analytical skills with demonstrated problem solving ability Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us. Company - Amazon Data Services, Inc. Job ID: A2289897

jobTitle: Water Infrastructure Manager, AWS Water Team
jobDescription: Job Summary DESCRIPTION AWS is looking for a results-oriented individual to join the AWS water infrastructure team. In this role, you will execute projects related to water based cooling system infrastructure with assistance from internal teams including construction, operations, engineering, environmental, and project commissioning teams. You will work with external engineering consultants and general contractors, water treatment and sampling vendors and local utilities to ensure projects meet regulatory standards and a high bar for operational efficiency, reliability, and safety. You will deliver water sustainability projects for AWS Infrastructure in US West regions, as you execute on the delivery of multiple water infrastructure development projects, monitor operational efficiency metrics, and build in system resiliency after project hand-off to regional operations teams. You will also be the central point of contact for all issues pertaining to water and wastewater treatment and disinfection systems and for managing healthy relationships with utilities. If you understand water-cooled infrastructure in building operations, are interested in innovation in the water sector, and understand the feasibility of construction under various designs, you are a probably a good fit! Key job responsibilities Responsibilities The Water Infrastructure Manager will be responsible for the following: Plan and implement water and wastewater infrastructure projects that support water delivery to data centers Engineer, implement and monitor water treatment/operations projects and identify optimal design criteria for scaling projects to full-scale deployment across different regions in North America. Work with internal teams to troubleshoot problems and conduct Root Cause Analysis (RCA) and Corrective Action (CA) for design and fleet deployed water systems. Work with local water utilities to understand and coordinate site utility requirements, site inspections and compliance with federal, state and municipal requirements and building codes. Track and manage reliability and maintenance of water systems, as well as the resiliency of sources of water supply required for data center cooling. Work with Operations to develop resiliency plans for water supply sources Deliver projects that directly support water sustainability goals Oversee support, and testing/validation of systems during installation, operation, and maintenance of water treatment equipment and associated mechanical system. Interface with internal engineering, operations, real estate and environmental health and safety teams to develop and implement solutions in rural areas that often lack adequate available water and wastewater infrastructure. Overseeing maintenance and compliance of on-site water treatment and disinfection systems. Up to 25% travel as needed for project execution where authorized. Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical/Chemical/Civil Engineering Excellent project management skills to balance multiple priorities in a fast scaling environment Working knowledge of water chemistry and conventional/membrane water treatment technologies for industrial applications with 5+years of experience with industrial or commercial engineering in data centers. Experience reading and interpreting construction drawings and equipment specifications and able to carry design concepts through exploration, development, and into deployment/scalable implementation. Strong understanding of mechanical/plumbing related to data centers or similar buildings that use water infrastructure such as pumps, cooling towers, evaporative media, heat exchangers, air handling units, or air economizers. 5+ years of project-related experience working with local or state government agencies, utilities, site development due diligence and/or permitting entities. Knowledge of water and wastewater regulations in the State of Oregon, Washington, Colorado, and/or California Preferred Qualifications Experience reading and interpreting construction drawings and equipment specifications and able to carry design concepts through exploration, development, and deployment/scalable implementation 7+ years of direct experience with the construction, operation, or maintenance of water treatment equipment fleet management. Advanced degree in Mechanical/Chemical/Environmental/Civil Engineering. Experience with fast track design/build projects and or multiple significant upgrade projects Analytical mindset that can identify gaps in requirements during project development, predict performance, and have the ability to provide recommendations on a short notice and with limited information. Knowledge or skills in SQL or data analytics tools such as Tableau Knowledge of water and wastewater regulations in Canada or Central America Spanish speaking abilities Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us. Company - Amazon Data Services, Inc. Job ID: A2243612

jobTitle: Work Based Learning Program Logistics Specialist
jobDescription: Description Amazon Web Services (AWS) is growing rapidly, and we are looking for a Data Center Logistics Specialist to join our expanding Infrastructure Operations team as part of our Work Based Learning Program (WBLP). Amazon has multiple WBLP trainee openings, and will start all technicians in September 2022. These trainees will participate in our 12-week work and training program in our New Albany, Hilliard, and Dublin, Ohio Data Centers. This position will help ensure overall availability and reliability to meet or exceed defined service levels of data center operations. The selected candidate must possess a strong work ethic, attention to detail, the ability to multitask and operate in a very fast paced complex environment, meet deadlines, and a commitment to Operational Excellence. The Logistics Specialist reviews Data Center inventory, in-bound shipments, and ongoing demand to ensure that proper stock levels are maintained in the all locations to support build and repair activities. Working with the Logistics Manager, they create plans to optimize the flow of parts through their lifecycle; tracking inventory location, movement, age, and turns. They work closely with Data Center Operations Technicians and Data Center Engineers to fulfill parts quickly and accurately. They work with Procurement and Hardware Engineering to purchase new parts and interface directly with vendors to process RMAs and receive replacements. Regular and ongoing communications with vendors to resolve issues and help them understand our business requirements necessitates a high level communicator. Responsibilities Data entry and resolving questions from peer organizations Ensure that all billing associated with the Inventory supply chain is accurate, validated and ready for processing Assembling, addressing, stamping and arranging for the shipment of merchandise and materials Assist in daily scheduling of deliveries and pick-ups to and from production locations Keep precise records of all commodities going in and out of company In addition, Logistics Specialists are expected to understand all aspects of production, adhere to strict safety standards, maintain very high quality, and be willing and able to work on powered equipment (i.e forklift or cherry picker). Physical/Environmental Requirements Requires standing, sitting, and walking for prolonged periods of time. Assist in loading and unloading shipments. Occasionally exposed to extreme cold or hot weather Work with and/or around moving mechanical parts Temperatures can vary between 60 and 90 degrees, and will occasionally exceed 90 degrees Must be able to lift loads of up to 49 pounds and carry them for short distances Continuously climb and descend stairs safely (applies to sites with stairs) Regularly walk, use hands and fingers, handle or feel, reach with hands and arms, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl Reach and stretch to position equipment and fixtures while maintaining balance Push or pull heavy objects into position Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. Basic Qualifications High school diploma or equivalent education 18 years or older Experience with Microsoft Office Ability to work 40 hours/week. Must be able to work 10 hour shifts as needed Able to start September 2022 Preferred Qualifications Familiarity with computer hardware components and operating systems Ability to manage work and priorities through a ticketing system and coordination with Manager Has taken STEM or vocational course curriculum Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us. Company - Amazon Data Services, Inc. Job ID: A2160247
